trade practices act 1974 (cth), ss. 52 (1), 53 (c), (d). mcdonald's was a fast food retailer which advertised one of its products as a "big mac" hamburger, and this name had become exceptionally well known to the public. mcwilliam's, a wine producer, published advertisements which showed three two-litre wine bottles and a wine writer who said "i call it the 'big mac'".
